edited by Nicole Greenhouse to reflect additional administrative information and added archived websites. Materials are in English.
New York University Archives
Records of the Office of Admissions
New York University
RG.12.3
2 Linear Feet 2 record cartons.
2 websites in 2 archived websites.
2013-ongoing This collection contains websites related to undergraduate admissions to attract new students to the university and help adjust them to NYU life.
Appraisal
Archived websites are made accessible for purposes of education and research. NYU Libraries have given attribution to rights holders when possible; however, due to the nature of archival collections, we are not always able to identify this information.
If you hold the rights to materials in our archived websites that are unattributed, please let us know so that we may maintain accurate information about these materials.
If you are a rights holder and are concerned that you have found material on this website for which you have not granted permission (or is not covered by a copyright exception under US copyright laws), you may request the removal of the material from our site by submitting a notice, with the elements described below, to the special.collections@nyu.edu.
Please include the following in your notice: Identification of the material that you believe to be infringing and information sufficient to permit us to locate the material; your contact information, such as an address, telephone number, and email address; a statement that you are the owner, or authorized to act on behalf of the owner, of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed and that you have a good-faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; a statement that the information in the notification is accurate and made under penalty of perjury; and your physical or electronic signature. Upon receiving a notice that includes the details listed above, we will remove the allegedly infringing material from public view while we assess the issues identified in your notice.
Conditions Governing Access
Material pertaining to individual student records may be restricted in accordance with the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA). Please contact the Archives with specific questions regarding access to such records.
Preferred Citation
To cite the archived website in this collection: Identification of item, date; Records of the Office of Admissions; RG 12.3; Wayback URL; New York University Archives, New York University.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
http://admissionsblog.nyu.edu/ was initially selected by curators as part of the Student Blogs Archive-it Collection. Archive-It uses web crawling technology to capture websites at a scheduled time and displays only an archived copy, from the resulting WARC file, of the website. In 2019, http://admissionsblog.nyu.edu/ redirected to https://meet.nyu.edu/. The accession number associated with this website is 2020.019.
Scope and Contents
This collection contains websites related to undergraduate admissions to attract new students to the university and help adjust them to NYU life.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist.
Processing Information
In September 2021, the archived websites were added to the resource record.
Biographical / Historical
The blog (http://admissionsblog.nyu.edu/) was established in December 2012 to attract new students to the university and help adjust them to NYU life. The website redirected to https://meet.nyu.edu/ in late 2019.
Universities and Colleges -- Admission.
Archived Websites2 websitesin 2 archived websites.October 2013-ongoing
NYU Admissions Blog Archived Website: October 2013-December 2019
Meet NYU Archived Website: December 2019-ongoing
Accruals
New site crawls are accrued quarterly.
Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.
Scope and Contents
This series includes websites related to undergraduate admissions to attract new students to the university and help adjust them to NYU life. The blog (http://admissionsblog.nyu.edu/) was established in December 2012 and consisted mostly of announcement posts for programming offered by the admissions department as well as deadlines and admissions decisions. In early 2013, articles began being published related to NYU welcome week, student experiences in New York City, jobs, internships, classes, study abroad, residential life, clubs, student government, and application advice. The blog was written by staff and students. In late 2019, the blog stopped being published and the website redirected to https://meet.nyu.edu/. Meet NYU is a blog produced by New York University Admissions intended to aid students in the application process by educating them about resources and providing advice. It includes videos and posts on application advice, information on campus resources, city life, communities and clubs, athletics, civic engagement, academics, study abroad, research, faculty, the Washington Square and Downtown Brooklyn campuses.
Appraisal
Crawl was limited to domains and subdomains of admissionsblog.nyu.edu and meet.nyu in order to remain within the collection scope and data constraints. Pinterest, Spotify, and Instagram were excluded from crawls.
